oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: US Model 1919 "Patton" saber
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This pattern was adopted for the mounted forces of the United States just after World War I. General George Patton, a veteran of World War I, was influential in the design and adoption of the sword. It had the potential for being used for both slashing and stabbing. It is marked "L.F. & C."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
